name: Electronic Braille Ready Format
summary: An EBRF file is a braille document saved in the Electronic Braille Ready Format (eBRF). It is a .ZIP archive that contains one or more .XHTML files, a .CSS file, and an images folder. EBRF files are used to show braille documents, including integrated tactile graphics, on multiline braille displays.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.

windows.display_name: Rename to use [f].zip[/f] extension; extract files using any Zip-decompression utility
